pages.text: The Entropy Reactor is your late-game power generation. This block, when used correctly, can produce very large amounts of energy.$(p)Keep reading to learn how to set it up.

pages.name: Entropy Reactor
pages.text: $(7)$(o)This is the setup, 26 Entropy Reactor Blocks and a Core in the middle.

When complete, SHIFT-RIGHT CLICK the center block on any side to finish the construction.$(p)This block has four important blocks around the outside:$(li)$(3)Screen, $()on the front, where you can access the machine.$(li)$(4)Power Port, $()left side of the Screen, allows removal of power.$(li)$(9)Item Port, $()right and back side of the Screen, allows insertion of fuel and removal of waste.

The Entropy Reactor's basic function is to burn $(5)Corrupted Shards,$() produced from $(l:blocks/liquids#condensed_void)Condensed Void.$()$(p)When idle, the Reactor will accept Shards through any Item Port. As soon as a Shard is put in, the Reactor will heat up for fifteen seconds, before combusting all Shards contained and providing a large burst of power.

More Shards will increase the FE/t, but to increase the length of time the power burst lasts for, you need to increase your $(6)Variety Rating.$()$(p)This is a percentage for every generation cycle that will be increased based on the variety of the original items the Shards are composed of.

For example, adding 20 of the identical corrupted item will generate 6,000FE/t, but only for one second, as the Variety is extremely low, totalling 120KFE generated.$(p)By contrast, adding 20 completely unique items in one cycle will generate 6,000FE/t, but for a whopping 10 seconds, totalling almost 1.1MFE.$(p)$(d)In summary, less unique items is better than more of the same item.

Of course, low power output is not the only reason to keep $(6)Variety$() high.$(br)Constantly low $(6)Variety$() will saturate your Core with $(c)Entropy, $()a dangerous compound that will cause more and more adverse effects the higher the saturation gets.$(br)$(c)If you let the core saturate completely, the Reactor will explode.$()$(p)Entropy can be lowered again by keeping $(6)Variety$() high.

pages.title: SD. Neutron Matter
pages.text: With energy, the Entropy Reactor produces $(2)Waste.$() The type produced depends on the $(6)Variety,$() with higher ratings making higher-quality Waste.$(p)The lowest-quality waste is $(3)Semi-Dense Neutron Matter.$() This generates whenever the condition for another Waste is not met.
The $(9)Quark Matter$() is the medium-rarity Waste produced by the Entropy Reactor. This is produced whenever the $(6)Variety Rating$() is greater than 20%.

The $(2)Strange Matter$() is the rarest Waste produced by the Entropy Reactor. This is produced whenever the $(6)Variety Rating$() is greater than 80%.$(p)This item is required for some recipes, unlike the other two Wastes, in which the product is interchangeable.

pages.title: Capacity Upgrade
pages.text: The $(2)Capacity Upgrade$() increases the internal $(d)Corrupted Shard$() storage, allowing more than 20 Shards to be loaded in per-operation.

pages.title: Cycle Delayer
pages.text: The $(2)Cycle Delayer Upgrade$() increases the length of time from start-of-loading to when the reactor powers up, allowing more time for $(d)Corrupted Shards$() to be loaded.

pages.title: Variety Upgrade
pages.text: The $(2)Variety Upgrade$() gives higher max $(6)Variety Rating,$() even allowing ratings over 100%.$(p)$(c)WARNING: This also lowers the minimum Variety Rating.

The $(d)Corrupt Shell$() is one by-product of a Core with high $(c)Entropy.$() In exchange for lowering the $(c)Entropy$() value, the Core will spawn these mobs around the reactor. $(p)This mob is blazing fast, very strong, and can locate you and seek you out from very far away. However, $(thing)perhaps their drops will come in handy later on.
This is $(item)Galactic Flesh.$() This item is a common drop from the $(d)Corrupt Shell.$()$(p)Eating this will restore some hunger and provide you with a completely random potion effect.
This is a $(item)Reality Crystal,$() an exceedingly rare drop from the $(d)Corrupt Shell.$() $(thing)Looting$() enchantments increase the chance to get this.

pages.title: E. Harnesser Upgrade
pages.text: The $(2)Entropic Harnesser Upgrade$() changes the reactor to produce only $(c)Entropy$() instead of FE, and will only perform $(d)World Corruption$() instead of the other negative effects.
